thread.title: Viola Davis's Acceptance Speech Gave A Powerful Nod To Her Father And People Were Moved
thread.title_full: Viola Davis's Acceptance Speech Gave A Powerful Nod To Her Father And People Were Moved

author: Izzy Francke
title: Viola Davis's Acceptance Speech Gave A Powerful Nod To Her Father And People Were Moved
text:
View this image ›
NBC / Via youtube.com ID: 10292924 2. She then paid tribute to her father: “And to the original Troy, my father, Dan Davis, born in 1936, groomed horses, had a fifth-grade education, didn’t know how to read until he was 15.” View this image ›
NBC / Via youtube.com ID: 10292946 3. She went on to thank August Wilson for telling her father’s story, and reminded us of the importance of diverse storytelling that reflects a multitude of backgrounds. View this image ›
NBC / Via youtube.com ID: 10293513 4. Her words hit home, and people were definitely here for it: View this image ›
Via Twitter: @mmpadellan ID: 10293726 5. It brought on all the EMOTIONS: View this image ›
Via Twitter: @rondaracha ID: 10293794 6. And some even called it the “best speech of the night.” View this image ›
Via Twitter: @meridak ID: 10293767 7. So here’s to Viola and the late Dan Davis! Congratulations on helping untold stories be told. View this image ›
Via Twitter: @alfonseeto ID: 10293840 8. Watch the full speech here: Video available at: https://youtube.com/watch?v=FwvKR0ODlWM . youtube.com / Via youtube.com ID: 10293864
